item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 30, 2025 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Everyone knows all the apps on your phone (413 points | 172 comments)
2. Show HN: Cloud-Ready Postgres MCP Server (56 points | 8 comments)
3. Utah becomes first US state to ban fluoride in its water (214 points | 435 comments)
4. Bringing Record and Replay debugging everywhere on Linux (22 points | 1 comment)
5. Convert Linux to Windows (159 points | 174 comments)
6. Towards fearless SIMD, 7 years later (99 points | 25 comments)
7. Why Apple's Severance gets edited over remote desktop software (422 points | 257 comments)
8. Atop 2.11 heap problems (131 points | 52 comments)
9. Self-contained Python scripts with uv (79 points | 13 comments)
10. Commercials that David Lynch directed (2018) (118 points | 27 comments)
11. Accessible open textbooks in math-heavy disciplines (180 points | 56 comments)
12. Paged Out #6 [pdf] (216 points | 17 comments)
13. C. Elegans: The Worm That No Computer Scientist Can Crack (29 points | 3 comments)
14. The disappearance of Gaia, ESA spacecraft will be turned off on 27 March 2025 (79 points | 24 comments)
15. XAN: A Modern CSV-Centric Data Manipulation Toolkit for the Terminal (70 points | 11 comments)
16. Matrix Calculus (For Machine Learning and Beyond) (108 points | 19 comments)
17. Lvgl: Embedded graphics library to create beautiful UIs (111 points | 23 comments)
18. The Mysterious Flow of Fluid in the Brain (24 points | 4 comments)
19. Koto Programming Language (161 points | 125 comments)
20. 6502 as a Service (24 points | 4 comments)
21. Introduction to Open Source Laptop Project (19 points | 4 comments)
22. Some Reflections After a Month of Tracking My Own Online Activity (3 points | discuss)
23. Veloren – voxel action-adventure role-playing (285 points | 68 comments)
24. Vramfs: Vram Based Filesystem for Linux (96 points | 32 comments)
25. Electric power generation from Earth's rotation through its own magnetic field (19 points | 14 comments)
26. Spark AI (YC W24) is hiring a full-stack engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
27. A timeline of IBM keyboard history (32 points | 4 comments)
28. OSS-SEC: Three bypasses of Ubuntu's unprivileged user namespace restrictions (53 points | 11 comments)
29. "Moonshots" Initiative to Secure the Future of RISC OS (29 points | 6 comments)
30. My TV started playing a video in full screen by itself. What happened? (293 points | 163 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 30, 2025 at 7:15 AM UTC
